summary.grammarTip:
'Was für ein...?' vs. 'Welch...?'

'Was für ein...?' and 'Welch...?' are both used to ask questions, but they have different meanings.

Was für ein...? (What kind of...?)

Use 'was für ein...?' to ask about the type, quality, or category of something in general. You are not choosing from a specific group.

The part 'was für' never changes. Only the 'ein-' part declines like the indefinite article (ein, eine, einen...). For plural, 'ein-' is dropped.

CaseMasculine (der)Feminine (die)Neuter (das)Plural (die)
NominativWas für einWas für eineWas für einWas für
AkkusativWas für einenWas für eineWas für einWas für

Examples:
• Was für ein Mann ist das? (What kind of man is that? - Nominativ)
• Was für einen Pullover suchst du? (What kind of sweater are you looking for? - Akkusativ)

Welch...? (Which...?)

Use 'welch...?' to ask about a specific choice from a known or limited group. You are asking 'which one(s)?'.

'Welch-' takes the same endings as the definite article (der, die, das, den...).

CaseMasculine (der)Feminine (die)Neuter (das)Plural (die)
NominativWelcherWelcheWelchesWelche
AkkusativWelchenWelcheWelchesWelche

Examples:
• Hier sind zwei Mäntel. Welcher ist deiner? (Here are two coats. Which one is yours? - Nominativ)
• Von diesen Hemden, welches nimmst du? (Of these shirts, which one are you taking? - Akkusativ)
